clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Chicken Egg Antibody (IgY) on Patients With Chronic Gastritis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Health Food Supplement Containing Anti-Helicobacter Pylori Urease IgY Antibody on Patients With Chronic Gastritis in Hanoi, Vietnam

brief_summary.textblock: H. pylori positive patient volunteers that passed the selection criteria are recruited and divided into a test and a control group. Both groups are treated with a current treatment regime (EAC: Esomeprazole 40 mg/day; Clarithromycin 1000 mg/day; Amoxicillin 2000 mg/day) but only the test group received IgY-containing food supplement as an adjunctive measure for 15 days. The subjects are examined before and 4 weeks after the treatment initiation by Urea Breath Test (UBT) and gastro-endoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of IgY in combination with EAC on Helicobacter pylori eradication in patients with chronic gastritis
primary_outcome.description: Urea Breath test (UBT) value was examined at baseline and 4 weeks after initiation of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of IgY in combination with EAC on severity of abdominal pain.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measures are the Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale (GSRS) scores using a four-point graded scale (0 = none: no symptoms; 1 = mild: awareness of sign or symptom, but easily tolerated; 2 = moderate: discomfort sufficient to cause interference with normal activities; 3 = severe: incapacitating with inability to perform normal activities).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of IgY in combination with EAC on nausea and vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measures are the Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale (GSRS) scores using a four-point graded scale (0 = no nausea; 1 = occasional episodes of short duration; 2 = frequent and prolonged nausea, no vomiting; 3 = continuous nausea, frequent vomiting)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of IgY in combination with EAC on bloating
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measures are the Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale (GSRS) scores using a four-point graded scale (0 = no or transient distension; 1 = occasional discomfort of short duration; 2 = frequent and prolonged episodes which can be mastered by adjusting the clothing; 3 = continuous discomfort seriously interfering with social performance)

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Gastritis Caused by Helicobacter Pylori

arm_group.description: The subjects take food supplement containing specific IgY (GastimunHP) during treatment with routine medical regime
The subjects undergo the routine treatment regime without taking food supplement

intervention.description: Health food supplement containing specific IgY against urease of H. pylori

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with gastritis or gastric ulcer who are positive to H. pylori
Exclusion Criteria:
- People allergic to egg proteins

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Diagnostic Endoscopy, 108 Military Central Hospital, Hanoi, Vietnam
